page.title: 10HOUSING
page.content: Rathenraw is the main{Housing Estate} in our area.Houses are rented and the estate is managed by the Northern Ireland Housing Executive.The estate has been well built with suitable open space and local services for the residents.There is also a Tenants' Association.However{vandalism}is a serious problem.Of 630 houses on the estate,over 120 are now empty and boarded up.The district heating scheme has been stopped because it was too expensive. {Rural housing}takes the form of solid stone farmhouses or modern bungalows built by those who wish to live in the peace of the countryside.Some of the latter cost over Â£60,000. Hungry Hall is an example of a large stone house which was formerly the dwelling of an estate owner.
